2:
|PROCEDURE|DESCRIPTION|
|---|---|
|Single Action Parts Catcher - Flat Door - Installation|This procedure shows you how to install the Single Action Parts Catcher on Flat Door ST-10/15 machines.|
|Dual Action Parts Catcher - Flat Door - Installation|This procedure shows you how to install the Dual Action Parts Catcher on Flat Door ST-10/15/20/25/30/35 machines.|
|Dual Action Parts Catcher - Actuator Replacement|This procedure shows you how to replace the Dual Action Parts Catcher Actuator on ST machines.|
|Single Action Parts Catcher - Angled Door - Installation|This procedure shows you how to install the Single Action Parts Catcher on Angled Door ST-20/25/30/35 and DS-30 machines.|

|mptom Table|Col2|Col3|
|---|---|---|
|SYMPTOM|POSSIBLE CAUSE|CORRECTIVE ACTION|
|Slow depolyment / moving chute|Lack of lubrication / Chip build up|Refer to Lubrication section below|
||Faulty rotary damper|Refer to Actuation section below|
||Lack of air supply|Check all air lines are porperly connected and verify solonoid functionality|

3:
If your PCAT is experiencing slow or
excessivly fast deployment it may be
due to a worn out damper.

Replace the rotary damper [2] by simply
removing the covering sheet metal and
hardware [1].

#### ï…œNote : An updated damper P/N 59
2164 is reccomended for this
replacement and is included in Svc Kit
93-3771 PCAT SVC KIT 3 N.M DAMPER
ST-10/20/30
